text: ğŸ“ŒMulti-omics technologies advance in molecular cell biology to understand and elucidate complexity of biological processes, especially when facing rare diseases and cell types. Modalities are continuously improving to advance in better therapeutic strategies related to disease markers and drug targets.  Above, the proof-of-concept study using multiomics data aimed to unravel age-related macular degeneration (AMD) pathophysiology.  Pathogenesis is still incompletely understood, but involves complement system (CS) activation and lipid dysregulation.  ğŸš©Differential of this study: a systematic multiomics data integration analysis (genetics, metabolomics and proteomics) in the context of AMD!  â–ªï¸Setting: 155 cases of AMD (SIE study) -77 female (49.7%), 83 hypertensive (53.5%), 45 diabetic (29%).  In discussion, authors reported that among all the possible interactions between complement proteins and lipids, a significant one was found between sphingomyelin and C1R. The odds of AMD were 2 times higher for individuals with low levels of sphingomyelin and C1R.  Sphingolipids are known to be involved in the regulation of many physiological and pathophysiological processes in the retina. Moreover, homeostasis of different sphingolipids plays a role in the maintenance, progression, and regulation of the immune response.  Limitations? Yes! Limitations include population ethnicity, limited sample size, early and intermediate AMD were pooled in a single category.  ğŸ˜ŠPrognosis and hope: In future, precision health will aim to predict, prevent, and cure diseases more precisely by taking into account each individualâ€™s genetics, environment, and lifestyle factors in contrast to the â€œone-size-fits allâ€ and reactive approach of traditional medicine.  â„¹ï¸Read more: â–ªï¸Interplay between Lipids and Complement Proteinsâ€”How Multiomics Data Integration Can Help Unravel Age-related Macular Degeneration Pathophysiology: A Proof-of-concept Study. text: Wall Street Week Ahead  DELL, CRWD, ADI, PONY, A, ZM, WWD, BBWI, SMTC, GES, MANU, WDAY, ADSK, PDCO, ZUO, MNSO, FRO  Wall Street will observe a holiday-shortened week due to Thanksgiving falling on Thursday. The stock market will close early on Friday.  Market participants still have a fairly busy economic calendar to look forward to, especially on Wednesday, which will see a flood of releases in the form of initial jobless claims, an updated estimate on U.S. GDP growth, and the October personal income and outlays data. That report will also contain a reading on the core personal consumption expenditures price index - widely seen as the Federal Reserve's favored inflation gauge.  Speaking of the Fed, the minutes of its November monetary policy committee meeting will be released on Tuesday. The odds of the central bank delivering another rate cut in December is now a toss-up, after chair Jerome Powell ten days ago said the economy was not "sending any signals that we need to be in a hurry to lower rates."  Turning to the earnings season, there are a few major names on tap to announce their numbers, including Dell (DELL), CrowdStrike (CRWD) and Analog Devices (ADI). Traders will also see a high-profile IPO this week in the form of Chinese robotaxi player Pony AI (PONY). The autonomous driving firm upsized its offering to 20M American depositary shares and expects to price it between $11 and $13 each, aiming for a valuation of up to $4.6B.  Earnings spotlight: Monday, November 25 - Agilent Technologies (A), Zoom Video Communications (ZM), Woodward (WWD), Bath & Body Works (BBWI), and Semtech (SMTC). See the full earnings calendar.  Earnings spotlight: Tuesday, November 26 - Analog Devices (ADI), Dell Technologies (DELL), CrowdStrike Holdings (CRWD), Guess? (GES), Manchester United (MANU), Workday (WDAY), and Autodesk (ADSK). See the full earnings calendar.  Earnings spotlight: Wednesday, November 27 - Patterson Companies (PDCO), Zuora (ZUO) and Frontline (FRO). See the full earnings calendar. Earnings spotlight: Friday, November 29 - MINISO Group Holding (MNSO). text: post3 ğŸ“ˆ The Evolution of Microprocessors: From Calculators to Artificial Intelligence 1970s: The Birth of Microprocessors and the Transistor Revolution The development of the transistor in 1947 led to a revolution in electronics, enabling the miniaturization of circuits and the creation of the first microprocessor: Intelâ€™s 4004, released in 1971. This 4-bit chip, which contained 2,300 transistors, could perform basic arithmetic and control functions in calculators. This milestone marked the start of single-chip computing, a precursor to the programmable devices we rely on today. Other key processors from this period include Intelâ€™s 8008, an 8-bit processor released in 1972, which introduced higher functionality for early computing devices. 1980s: The Rise of 16-Bit and 32-Bit Chips & the Era of Personal Computing With the progress of integrated circuits and advancements in reducing transistor sizes, 16-bit and later 32-bit processors entered the scene, delivering unprecedented power and flexibility. The Intel 8086, launched in 1978, introduced the foundational x86 architecture, which would dominate computing for decades. Later, the Intel 80286 brought memory management enhancements, enabling the transition to more complex software environments. Notable processors included: Intel 8086 â€“ The original x86, known for powering the IBM PC in the early 1980s. Intel 80286 â€“ First used in IBM PC/AT computers, offering improved memory management. Motorola 68000 â€“ Widely used in Appleâ€™s original Macintosh and early gaming consoles. These processors fueled the personal computer revolution, making computers accessible for home and office use and transforming the modern workplace. 1990s: The Era of Multi-Core Processors, 64-Bit Computing, and the Pentium Line The 1990s witnessed the rise of 64-bit processors and higher clock speeds, pushing the boundaries of desktop computing. Multi-core designs began emerging as manufacturers faced thermal limits in single-core processors, allowing computers to perform more tasks simultaneously. This period saw the introduction of processors that could handle graphics, multimedia, and increasingly sophisticated software. Notable processors from this era included: Intel Pentium Series â€“ A groundbreaking processor line starting in 1993, the Pentium became synonymous with fast, multimedia-capable computing, ushering in the era of advanced desktop computing. AMD K6 and Athlon Series â€“ Competitors to Intelâ€™s Pentium line, AMDâ€™s processors offered similar power, marking a significant rivalry. Sun Microsystems UltraSPARC â€“ A powerful 64-bit processor used in high-performance servers and workstations. These innovations allowed for advanced applications in gaming, multimedia, and scientific computing, as well as early human-centered interfaces that made computers central to daily life.

name: Erik Rakhou
position: Energy Policies expert | Associate Director BCG | Management consulting | Former member ACER Board of Appeal | Initiator and co-author "Touching Hydrogen Future" | #5 ğŸŒthought leader Hydrogen @Illuminem | Podcast cohost
text: Rethinking the BCG Matrix used to prioritise investments and divestments for Renewable Fuels: Policy Alignment vs. Agility".   As I was preparing for the and conference in Berlin on 11 December, my daughter who is studying economics in Rotterdam walked in - and showed me her textbook with now quite old framework* - the BCG Matrix used to decide on portfolio of businesses to divest and invest in. She asked me - is this relevant in your work still dad?  This made me step back, smile and start reflecting on how traditional frameworks like the for prioritising investments might evolve for the renewable fuels world. What if we rethought the axes?  Instead of market share and market growth, imagine the BCG Matrix used to prioritise investments or divestments mapped to:  Policy Alignment (X-axis): How aligned is a company's strategy with regulatory direction?  Agility (Y-axis): How quickly can a company adapt to shifting energy policies and market needs?  With these new axes, who would be the of renewable fuels? Likely, itâ€™s firms leading in both agility and alignmentâ€”think digital-first hydrogen pioneers, flexible biofuel / efuel innovators, and CCUS-driven decarbonization platforms. These companies have both the policy focus and ability to pivot as targets evolve.  Cash ? Established LNG exporters or oil majors investing heavily in biofuels amd Hydrogen derivatives â€”well aligned but slower to adapt.  ? Early-stage hydrogen startups or e-fuel developersâ€”innovative but navigating regulatory ambiguity.  to divest? Technologies with high inertia and weak alignment, such as rigid fossil-dependent processes firms that refuse to back energy transition.  For investors and policymakers, this reframed matrix underscores importance of two challenges when thinking on investment landscape improvement for moving gasworld to netzero:  1) How do we foster policy clarity to guide policy alignment for energy industry?  2) How can industry enhance agility in navigating rapid transitions to follow and anticipate policy?  Looking forward to exploring this idea and debating in our panel with energy leaders in Berlin on 11 December including,, and.  Whatâ€™s your take? Are ability to deal with agility and policy alignment the right metrics for picking the firms best positioned for the renewable fuels transition? Let me know, or letâ€™s grab a coffee in Berlin.  For more on the conference and agenda:  Note - this is 3rd in series of 5 posts preparing for the conference.

text: Excited to share that I've completed the Python for Data Science course, which is part of the IBM Professional Data Science Certification! ğŸ‰ As part of this course, I worked on a Stock and Revenue Analysis Project that allowed me to apply key data science techniques to analyze the stock performance and revenue trends of leading companies: Tesla, Apple, AMD, Amazon, and GameStop. Here's a quick summary of what I did: Project: Stock and Revenue Analysis Tesla: Analyzed the upward trend in stock price, rising from $90 to over $900, driven by growth in the electric vehicle market and investor confidence. Apple: Explored stock price growth from $10 to $145 and the increasing dividends, showcasing strong financial health. AMD: Focused on early stock volatility, followed by stabilization as investors gained confidence in its technological innovations. Amazon: Used web scraping with BeautifulSoup to retrieve live stock data, uncovering Amazonâ€™s strength in e-commerce and cloud computing. GameStop: Compared Teslaâ€™s steady growth to GameStopâ€™s speculative surge, driven by social media and retail investors. Key Learnings: Gained practical experience with Python, Pandas, and BeautifulSoup for data manipulation, analysis, and web scraping. Developed insights into financial data analysis, leveraging stock price data to understand company performance. Improved data visualization skills using Plotly and Matplotlib, presenting complex data in an insightful way. Learned the importance of sustainable stock growth based on business fundamentals versus speculative trading. Iâ€™m excited to continue my journey towards completing the IBM Professional Data Science Certification, and I look forward to applying these skills in real-world data science projects! ğŸš€

name: Qazi Fabia Hoq
position: Certified Data Analyst | Business Analyst | Tableau Developer | SQL | Python | Visualization | Power Bi | Data Analysis | Database | Google Collab | Machine Learning | Google Data Analytics Professional Certificate
text: Excited to share my recent IBM Python for Data Science Project: Stock and Revenue Analysis! This project uses data science techniques to analyze stock performance and revenue trends of Tesla, GameStop, Apple, AMD, and Amazon. I employed historical stock data, web scraping, and data visualization to uncover valuable insights into each companyâ€™s financial performance. Project Breakdown: Tesla (TSLA) Stock price surged from $90 to $900 by mid-2021, reflecting market expansion and investor confidence in EVs. Revenue Insight: Teslaâ€™s stock correlates with its consistent revenue growth, driven by innovation in sustainable energy. Apple (AAPL) Stock price grew from $10 in 2010 to $145 in 2021, with steady dividend increases, showing strong financial health. Insight: Apple's steady growth and global market expansion reflect a solid business model. AMD (AMD) Early stock volatility with a 219,600-share first-day volume, followed by stabilization as investor interest grew. Insight: Early volatility indicated high investor enthusiasm, which later translated to sustained interest. Amazon (AMZN) Using BeautifulSoup, I scraped live stock data, showing Amazonâ€™s price of $656.29, underlining its market dominance. Insight: Amazonâ€™s growth is backed by its scalable market strategies in e-commerce and cloud computing. GameStop (GME) Compared Teslaâ€™s steady growth to GameStopâ€™s speculative surge, which peaked at $483 in early 2021 before crashing. Insight: Teslaâ€™s rise is grounded in fundamentals, while GameStopâ€™s surge was driven by speculative trading. Technologies Used: Python for analysis Pandas for data manipulation BeautifulSoup for web scraping Plotly & Matplotlib for visualizations Jupyter Notebooks for documenting Conclusion: This project provides insights into stock and revenue performance, highlighting Teslaâ€™s growth through innovation, Appleâ€™s stable business model, and Amazonâ€™s scalability. GameStopâ€™s rise emphasizes the risks of speculative trading. Looking forward to enhancing this with machine learning models for stock predictions and improving web scraping for real-time data.

name: Jaya Jagadish
position: Country Head and Senior Vice President, AMD India
text: AMD India celebrates 20 amazing years of innovation, growth, and excellence! I am filled with immense pride and gratitude as I reflect on our journey. This isn't just about celebrating our accomplishments but also about recognizing the passion, dedication, and innovation of every AMD employee, past and present. Thank you for being the driving force behind our success.  We marked another key milestone with the inauguration of our phase 2 Global Design Centre, a moment made even more special by the presence of our Chair & CEO,, and CTO,.  Lisa Su's visionary leadership has been the cornerstone of AMD's remarkable transformation, and her journey continues to be a source of inspiration for all. Similarly, India's growth has been supported by the inspiring leadership of Mark Papermaster. Since 2011, as our executive sponsor, Mark has consistently provided guidance that empowers us to overcome challenges and seize new opportunities. Together, their leadership has been a driving force behind AMD India's success.  What started as a small group of engineers two decades ago has now grown into AMD's largest Global Design Center, with India proudly housing 25% of AMD's global design workforce. Our engineers here contribute to every AMD product, leaving a mark on the global tech landscape.  Personally, for me, the past 20 years have been a remarkable journey of growth, learning, and transformation. Beginning my career as an MTS and progressing to the role of SVP has been an enriching experience. The opportunities I've been given, the challenges I've faced, and the experiences I've gained have helped me become the person I am today.  Thank you, AMD, for these 20 amazing years!  As we look forward, I couldn't be more excited about what lies ahead. The next chapter of AMD India's story will be about pushing the boundaries of innovation and contributing to a smarter, more connected world. Here's to the next 20 years of excellence, collaboration, and growth!  Farouk Fathima

name: Values
text: ğŸŒğ’ğ®ğ§ğğšğ² ğ¬ğ©ğğœğ¢ğšğ¥: ğ‚ğ¡ğ¢ğ©ğ¥ğğ­-ğğšğ¬ğğ ğ€ğ«ğœğ¡ğ¢ğ­ğğœğ­ğ®ğ«ğ: ğ“ğ¡ğ ğğğ±ğ­ ğğ¢ğ  ğ“ğ¡ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ¢ğ§ ğ’ğğ¦ğ¢ğœğ¨ğ§ğğ®ğœğ­ğ¨ğ«ğ¬ ğŸš€  As demand grows for more powerful and efficient processors, the limitations of traditional monolithic chip designs have become more evident. This is where chiplet-based architecture steps in, addressing critical challenges in scalability, performance, and cost-effectiveness.  + ğ–ğ¡ğ² ğˆğ­ ğ‚ğšğ¦ğ ğ­ğ¨ ğ„ğ±ğ¢ğ¬ğ­ğğ§ğœğ The push toward smaller nodes and higher processing power has led to increased manufacturing complexity and costs. Large monolithic chips are harder to yield and come with greater risk for defects, raising production costs. Chiplet architecture was introduced to combat these issues, allowing manufacturers to produce smaller, specialized chiplets that are then integrated into a larger system.  + ğ“ğ¡ğ ğŒğğ­ğ¡ğ¨ğ Chiplet-based designs break down a processor into modular "chiplets," each handling specific functions, such as CPU, GPU, memory, or I/O. These chiplets are then interconnected within a single package using advanced interconnect technologies. This modular approach reduces the risk of defects, as only individual chiplets need to be produced flawlessly, enhancing overall yields and flexibility.  + ğ‡ğ¨ğ° ğˆğ­â€™ğ¬ ğ‚ğ¡ğšğ§ğ ğ¢ğ§ğ  ğ­ğ¡ğ ğ’ğğ¦ğ¢ğœğ¨ğ§ğğ®ğœğ­ğ¨ğ« ğ‹ğšğ§ğğ¬ğœğšğ©ğ Chiplet architecture is paving the way for the future of high-performance computing, enabling faster, more flexible, and cost-effective designs. By allowing companies to mix and match components, itâ€™s speeding up development cycles and opening new doors for customized solutions across AI, data centers, and mobile devices. According to SemiEngineering, chiplet-based designs can significantly reduce costs and power consumption while increasing performance, especially as advanced packaging solutions continue to evolve.  As more companies like AMD, Intel, and TSMC invest in chiplet technology, we can expect it to become a standard for high-performance applications, transforming everything from cloud computing to edge devices.  For more on this topic, check out insights on @SemiEngineering! ğŸ› ï¸ğŸ”— ğŸ”— Link:

text: Hereâ€™s a comprehensive LinkedIn post that combines your experiences from both Day 1 and Day 2 at Ignite 2024, presented in an engaging and elaborate way: ğŸŒŸ Ignite 2024: A Journey of Innovation and Insight ğŸŒŸ Iâ€™m thrilled to share my experiences from the first two days of Microsoft Ignite 2024! The event has been a treasure trove of knowledge, showcasing the latest advancements in technology and their applications across various industries. Day 1 Highlights Improving Accuracy on GenAI Apps with Azure Database and PostgreSQL I kicked off my Ignite journey with a session focused on enhancing the accuracy of GenAI applications. The case study presented on NestlÃ© was particularly enlightening, demonstrating how they utilize Azure Database and PostgreSQL to drive operational efficiency. Key insights included: The critical role of data accuracy in AI applications. Strategies for integrating robust databases to support AI-driven decision-making. This session underscored the potential of leveraging data to create more reliable and effective AI solutions. Day 2 Highlights Building Intelligent Applications with AI and Power Apps Day 2 began with an inspiring session on building intelligent applications using AI and Power Apps. We explored how integrating AI capabilities can transform application development, making it more user-centric and efficient. Real-time Data Insights: The ability to analyze data instantly for informed decision-making. User-Centric Design: Tailoring applications to enhance user engagement and satisfaction. The New Era of Industrial Digitalization and Manufacturing Innovation Next, I attended a session that delved into the impact of digital technologies on the manufacturing sector. We discussed how companies are embracing digitalization to enhance efficiency and foster innovation. Advanced Analytics and IoT: Utilizing real-time monitoring to boost productivity. AI in Manufacturing: Implementing AI for predictive maintenance and quality control. Build and Modernize AI Apps on Azure The afternoon featured a deep dive into building and modernizing AI applications on Azure. This session highlighted: Scalability and Flexibility: How Azure supports seamless scaling of AI applications. Best Practices: Effective strategies for modernizing existing applications to leverage AI capabilities. Delight Your Customer Finally, I attended a session focused on enhancing customer experiences through technology. We explored the importance of understanding customer needs and leveraging data to create personalized interactions. Customer-Centric Approach: Emphasizing the need to prioritize customer satisfaction in business strategies. Data-Driven Insights: Using analytics to better understand customer behavior.

name: Brittany Blackman
position: Entrepreneur. Dreamer. Believer in good things. Positive vibe sharer.
text: Happy Anniversary to my best friend ğŸ‘«  Finding someone who believes in, cherishes, and supports you is not only soul-fulfillling, but also a huge key to success.  See, I fell in love with this man almost 10 years ago at a wine festival ğŸ· (He'll tell you I stumbled into him, but rest assured, there was no stumbling in those shoes, or I would have wound up with a broken ankle ğŸ˜‚)  At that time, I didn't quite understand what all it was he would offer to me in life, and as I look back at the past decade, I realize how much more he has given me...  A safe home A tissue-hander A safety net A cheerleader A chef A captain A comedian A lover A fighter (in all the good ways) A best friend  This man has offered me his life and made me part of his.  Over the years, I have battled job changes, insecurities, loneliness, hyper anxiety, excruciatingly high self-expectations, self-esteem issues, amd so much more. This man has stood beside me, picked me up, and asked how he can support me, every. single. time.  What advise would I share? Take the time to find the people who make your soul sparkle ğŸ’–  I pray, whether it's a friend or family, that you, too, can experience the magic in finding your tribe âœ¨ï¸  To my husband, Stan, thank you. The words will never be enough, but I hope my love to you shows how truly appreciative I am of you and our relationship. Now, let's go fish around the world! BFFL ğŸ«‚

name: Robert Kargbo
position: CMC Project Lead at Usona Institute
text: Age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is a progressive degenerative disease that leads to visual impairment, predominantly affecting the elderly. Despite significant advancements in treatment, a definitive cure remains elusive. Current therapeutic strategies only slow down disease progression, inhibiting abnormal blood vessels growth, and preserving or improving vision. Among these strategies, photodynamic therapy (PDT) has emerged as a promising treatment, particularly for neovascular form, the most severe form of the disease. Although several photosensitizers (PS) have been developed, only one has received clinical approval for use in AMD. This treatment involves the intravenous administration of a photosensitizing agent that preferentially accumulates in the abnormal blood vessels beneath the macula. Upon activation by targeted laser light, the PS triggers photochemical reactions, leading to vascular occlusion and the reduction of choroidal neovascularization. This review provides a comprehensive overview of both experimental and clinical studies on PDT for AMD, discussing the current state of research, challenges in treatment optimization, and potential future directions to enhance this therapeutic approach.-

text: Hi Folks, This guide introduces the main features of Advanced Microcontroller Bus Architecture (AMBA) AXI. name: Alok Tripathi
text: Sincerely appealing to Y, pls join & strengthen AI-RAN Alliance, usher in a new era   â–ªï¸Y's Accelerated Computing  Y's comprehensive stack includes acceleration for training and inferencing and supported by tools, frameworks and software.    Hardware performance is critical. Y's Modern CPUs have evolved to help make AI performant for the RAN. The modern CPUs include several features that accelerate AI models. These include Vector Extensions for , support for lower precision calculations for faster AI training and inference, Matrix Extensions etc.  Y's modern CPUs support Layer 1&2 functions as well as efficiently run the AI models to achieve a robust AI-for-RAN realisation.    Y's partner Vendor-X, a founding member of AI-RAN Alliance, has developed embedded for multiple NR signal processing algorithms with a precisely designed deep neural network ( ).  Y and X have collaborated to bring this transformational AI software to market as part of the Y's (Y1) software suite.  X's 5G AI embedded software provides DNN-based physical uplink shared channel (PUSCH) channel estimation routines (for standard MIMO), and SRS channel estimation and pre-coding routines (for ). X's 5G AI software components can be leveraged by existing customers of Y1 suite without additional hardware or software stack changes.  By using for L1 processing, less compute is required to process the uplink (PUSCH) signals in standard MIMO configurations, increasing the number of sectors per server and reducing their cost of operation.  The ML-driven L1 processing improves SINR that enables increased throughput and coverage, optimizing the value and utilization of costly spectrum licenses and band allocations. SINR improvements can also enable bandwidth increases, reduced user traffic latency, and a smaller interference margin for cell planning.    To help developers take advantage of Y's modern CPUs, Y has a strong software support for developer ecosystem.  Y has released optimized libraries, such as Y's Deep Neural Network Library, Math Kernel Library, and AI & Data Analytics Library etc.  Tragedy is Y has not joined the AI-RAN Alliance.  â–ªï¸ Divide & Rule  N is a founding member of AI-RAN Alliance and there is a fierce historic rivalry between N and Y, but still both are deeply committed to unlock AI's potential for / .  Their hw & sw approach differs, but they have a common mighty #1 enemy in Team ClosedRAN.  Some key influencers, in leading publications, churn out weekly articles, based on opportunistically crafted questions to get sound-bites from gullible executives of Y, N, AMD, ARM etc. and play them condemning each other's technology.  Meanwhile, Team SRAN quietly chuckles at their division and rules the RAN market.  Since times immemorial, "Divide and Rule" strategy works marvellously.  : I appeal to all to unite in "open" mission and never forgetting the #1 enemy.

name: Yigit Karatas
position: Digital Product & Process Lead at Vodafone | Researcher @Kadir Has CESD | Global Shaper @World Economic Forum | University of Oxford
text: ğŸš€ El Capitan: A Game Changer for Science and National Security (!) ğŸš€  ğŸŒThe National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) has unveiled El Capitan, the fastest supercomputer in the world, at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. With the power to perform over 2,700 quadrillion operations per second, El Capitan is not just a technological marvelâ€”itâ€™s a revolution in computational science.  ğŸ§ Built-in collaboration withand, this exascale system is designed to solve some of the most complex problems related to nuclear stockpile stewardship, AI training, and large-scale simulation. It will empower researchers to model and simulate nuclear weapons performance, materials science, and climate change with unprecedented speed and detail.  ğŸ’»But the journey doesnâ€™t stop there. Tuolumne, a smaller but equally powerful system, will expand the scope to unclassified science, supporting global efforts in astrophysics, nuclear structure, and more. Excited about the possibilities this technology unlocks for the future of science and national security.  ğŸ’¡El Capitan, in particular, is expected to significantly enhance the capabilities of the Stockpile Stewardship Program, allowing for a more detailed understanding of nuclear weapon physics, the effects of weapon aging, and the overall integrity of stockpiles. This method not only provides real-time insights but also supports long-term nuclear non-proliferation goals, ensuring that nations can monitor and maintain nuclear arsenals without resorting to destructive testing.  ğŸ“Œ Ethical and Political Dimensions  While nuclear simulations offer a path forward in the absence of physical testing, they also raise important ethical and political questions. The CTBT was designed not only to prevent the development of new nuclear weapons but also to limit the further proliferation of nuclear capabilities. The reliance on simulation, however, could allow countries to continue to enhance their nuclear stockpiles under the radar, potentially undermining the spirit of disarmament efforts.  Additionally, the technological advancements that enable such simulations also bring concerns related to arms races, with countries possibly engaging in a competitive development of more advanced weapons under the guise of maintaining or improving existing arsenals. The balance between leveraging advanced technology for peaceful purposes and preventing further escalation of nuclear capabilities remains a delicate issue in international diplomacy.

name: Krijan Danekhu
position: Senior Sales Executive at MomTech IT
text: hello everyone  lately there are huge numbers of companies offering freelance and online jobs in internet, people promising other to earn 50000 per month and some of them giving a particular task like translation ,logo design and typing. But soon after we complete task ,they will say they gonna send the payment but at the last moment they will say our ID is not registered amd asks for $50 or couple of amount in order to receive payment.  the most skeptical thing is ,where you complete the task worth $20-$30 but the company will say that they will send around $1500 t0 $2000 and ask for a non refundable registration or of $50 which tottaly doesn't make sense.  a lot of people has fallen in this trap ,amd the worst part is we won't be able to to cyber complaint since it's a small amount but as per the engagement on post,we can clearly see that there are large number of victims who got scammed.  so here we wasted our time by completing the task and not even get paid.i would like to request to all of you for a help to stop this scam. atleast we can help people who got scammed and return their money.the numbers of scammed person are increasing day by day . Help post

name: Tuan Shums
text: MSI modular motherboard will support both Intel and AMD CPUs...?  Modern computers don't need replacing anywhere near as often as they did 20 years ago, but replacing your OS installation and building a brand-new rig from scratch is still a major hassle.  MSI wants to solve that problem once and for all, whether you prefer Intel processors or AMD APUs.  MSI's engineers have found a way to resurrect the concept with a lot of hard work and a little bit of Taiwanese magic.   Cyrix: Gone But Not Forgotten   Intel-Compatible Processors (AMD and Cyrix)   Open standard instruction set  Risc-v-mainboard   Engineers Could use their knowledge, skills, and creativity to design, build, and maintain systems, structures, and technologies  "It seems Impossible, Until it is done"

name: VLSI Lab PoliTO
text: This week, our teammate Christian Conti presented at the IEEE International Conference on Electronics Circuits and Systems (ICECS) 2024 in Nancy the article:  ğŸ“ "AMARETTO: Enabling Efficient Quantum Algorithm Emulation on Low-Tier FPGAs", authored by:,,,, and  AMARETTO (quAntuM ARchitecture EmulaTion TechnOlogy) is a digital architecture designed for quantum computing emulation on low-tier FPGAs, supporting Clifford+T and rotational gate sets. It has been conceived to simplify and accelerate quantum algorithm verification. It utilizes a Reduced-Instruction-Set-Computer (RISC)-like structure for efficient handling of sparse quantum gates and integrates a dedicated compiler to translate OpenQASM 2.0 into RISC-like instructions. Validated against Qiskit simulators, AMARETTO successfully emulates up to 16 qubits on an AMD Kria KV260 SoM, rivaling other works in emulated qubit capacity while using a smaller, more affordable FPGA.  Weâ€™re thrilled to share that the article is now available on arXiv: ğŸ‘‰  A big congratulations to Christian for representing the work so brilliantly! ğŸŒŸ

name: Trilok C
text: hashtag #basisNuLite : the NEW Topology Pedagogy   With the Quantum domain unfolding at rapid pace, it is timely to assert the flaws in the current topology sorting methods, that are directly reducing the performance - both hardware and software wise.  The world, all over, has been following old and poor mathematics on determining the causal relations, which bind a topological system together.  In contrast, the ofprovides an all important evolutionary course-correction in topological sorting, whereby the causal relations are faster and much lower than derived by the mathematics known till date.  What do you get?  Well, a refined architecture with one new Basis Function of Linear Algebra particularly addressing the layout schemes for the 'number of qubits' to the 'possible states they derive' relation. So, bring in any number of size requirements to the and lo...it will accurately present the layouts at a much smaller size for hardware and software design.             ( )

text: World generation organize itself with the new technology every civilization have comes with the great innovation for our generation we have quantum technologies one of the most important part of these technologies are quantum computers are the programming known as artificial intelligence Combination of these 2 categories will give us a great effort to unlock lot of potential programming which has never been done before why the power of computing and the artificial intelligence we will get some great security for humankind at leading laboratories and tech companies have started to figure out how to harness the power of quantum mechanics to make a new generation of super quantum computers â€” infinitely faster and more powerful than even todayâ€™s fastesthas built a quantum computer thatâ€™s about 158 million times faster than the worldâ€™s fastest supercomputer.Quantum computing is starting to come into its own. By dramatically increasing computing Quantum Computing: the Key to Unlocking AIâ€™s Full Potential?â€ was previously published in July 2024 with the title, â€œHow Quantum Computing Is Already Changing the World.â€ It has since been updated to include the most relevant information available. capacity and speed, this should help greatly accelerate the AIzooming out to take in the bigger picture, I can identify the technological megatrends that are sure to reshape the world over the next decade. From there, I can home in on the stocks on the cutting edge of those megatrends.I did this in 2015, when many were panicking about plunging oil prices and a global economic slowdown. That same year, I recommended investors buy the dip in an up-and-coming chipmaker called Advanced Micro Devices (AMD). A few years later, AMD stock had soared more than 8,000%. I was also able to do this in 2018, when the market was crashing due to the Fedâ€™s aggressive rate hikes. In the midst of that crash, I recommended investors buy the dip in tech stocks like The Trade Desk (TTD), Roku (ROKU), and Tesla (TSLA). All three went on to soar around 1,000% over the next two years Let me start my discussion of quantum computing by saying that the underlying physics of this technological breakthrough â€“ quantum mechanics â€“ is a highly complex topic. It would likely require over 500 pages to fully understand.For centuries, scientists have developed, tested, and validated the laws of the physical world, known as classical mechanics. These scientifically explain how and why things work, where they come from, so on and so forth.But in 1897, J.J. Thomson discovered the electron. And he unveiled a new, subatomic world of super-small things that didnâ€™t obey the laws of classical mechanicsâ€¦ at all. Instead, they obeyed their own set of rules, which have since become known as quantum mechanics.The rules of quantum mechanics differ from that of classical mechanics in two very weird, almost-magical ways. name: Jairo do
text: ğŸ’» The Evolution of Chips: Where Are We Heading? Chips are the unsung heroes of our digital age. From powering smartphones to enabling breakthroughs in AI, semiconductors are the foundation of nearly every technology we depend on. As someone whoâ€™s deeply invested in this space, I wanted to share some thoughts on where I see the future of chips headingâ€”and why itâ€™s such an exciting time to be part of this industry. ğŸ“ˆ Key Trends Shaping the Chip Industry 1ï¸âƒ£ The Shift to Advanced Packaging and Chiplets The days of monolithic chips are fading. Advanced packaging technologies, like chiplets and 3D stacking, are allowing us to integrate different functionalities into a single package, increasing performance and flexibility. Companies like AMD and Intel are leading the charge, and itâ€™s only the beginning. 2ï¸âƒ£ The AI Revolution Needs New Silicon Generative AI, large language models, and edge computing are driving demand for specialized silicon. GPUs, TPUs, and custom AI accelerators are being optimized for massive parallel processing and energy efficiency. The race to deliver chips tailored for AI workloads is heating up. 3ï¸âƒ£ Beyond Silicon: The Rise of New Materials As we approach the physical limits of silicon, the industry is exploring alternatives like gallium nitride (GaN), silicon carbide (SiC), and graphene. These materials could unlock higher performance and energy efficiency for applications like 5G, EVs, and space tech. 4ï¸âƒ£ Sustainability in Manufacturing Chip production is energy- and resource-intensive. To stay competitive, manufacturers are focusing on green manufacturing processes, water recycling, and transitioning to renewable energy. The industryâ€™s future depends on balancing innovation with sustainability. 5ï¸âƒ£ Geopolitics and Supply Chain Resilience Recent years have exposed the vulnerabilities of the global semiconductor supply chain. Governments and companies are responding by investing in domestic production and reducing reliance on single-region manufacturing hubs. The CHIPS Act in the U.S. is just one example of this shift. Chips arenâ€™t just about computingâ€”theyâ€™re about enabling the future. The devices we use, the data we process, and the experiences we create all depend on advancements in semiconductor technology. As someone working in this field, Iâ€™m inspired by the challenges and opportunities ahead. Whether itâ€™s optimizing performance for AI models, solving supply chain issues, or driving sustainable production, this industry is at the heart of global innovation.

name: Aditya Raj
position: Cloud | Linux | Kubernetes | Docker | Security & Networking | C++ Enthusiast
text: What Are Meltdown and Spectre Vulnerabilities? In 2018, two major vulnerabilities shook the tech world: Meltdown and Spectre. These flaws were found in modern processors (like Intel, AMD, and ARM) and impacted almost all devicesâ€”computers, servers, and smartphones. What Went Wrong? Modern processors use a feature called speculative execution to boost speed by predicting tasks. Hackers found a way to exploit this and access sensitive data like passwords and encryption keys. Meltdown: Hackers could directly access the CPUâ€™s restricted memory, which should be private to the system. Think of it as someone unlocking a staff-only room and stealing confidential files. Spectre: Hackers could trick applications into revealing their private data. Itâ€™s like peeking into someone elseâ€™s notebook without them knowing. Why Does This Matter? Widespread Impact: Almost all devices with modern processors were affected. Sensitive Data Leaks: Passwords, encryption keys, and personal data were at risk. Stealthy: These vulnerabilities were hard to detect. What Was Done to Fix It? Software Updates were released to patch these flaws. New Processor Designs now make speculative execution more secure. The Lesson: Even the most advanced systems can have flaws. Regular updates and better security practices are crucial for protecting our devices.

name: Mangala Prasad Sahu
text: I am truly honoured and privileged to have received the 9th President of India, Dr. Shankar Dayal Sharma Gold Medal for academic excellence as the topper of the University inComputer Science from Sri Sathya Sai Institute of Higher Learning. It was a humbling experience to receive this prestigious award from the Honourable Dr. Sethuraman Panchanathan, 15th Director of the U.S. National Science Foundation, during the 43rd Convocation of SSSIHL. As I pause my academic career and embark on my professional journey, I would like to express my heartfelt gratitude to my teachers at SSSIHL whose wisdom and mentorship have been invaluable in shaping my academic path. I am also deeply thankful to my family, friends, and mentors who have supported me every step of the way. A special mention goes to a few individuals who have played a key role in my professional growth and sparked my interest in computer architecture and CPU performance analysis. I would like to thank(Modeling Engineer, AMD),(Principal CPU Architect, ARM), and(Distinguished Engineer, IBM) for their constant support and guidance. I also extend my sincere thanks to my amazing teamIndia India Systems Development Labs, who have been a pillar of support in my professional journey. This award is dedicated to my guru, Sri Sathya Sai Baba, whose teachings and wisdom have been a constant source of inspiration and light in my life.

text: Is the Future of Tech Startup Funding in Trouble? ğŸ¤”  The recent surge in funding we saw last year seems to be hitting a roadblock. Is that a sign of a fading startup dream? Letâ€™s dive into the latest news shaping the European tech landscape.  1. Finn Stevenson on Healthcare Innovation ğŸ¥ Finn Stevenson, CEO of Flok Health, has set the stage by leading the UK's first AI-powered physiotherapy clinic. This intersection of tech and healthcare is both exciting and daunting. What challenges are startups facing when entering this crucial sector? Can they truly transform how we manage our health in the age of AI?  2. AMD's New Horizons in Tech ğŸŒ‰ California-based AMD is advancing its product offerings for next-gen computing. Their bold moves showcase the vibrancy of tech startups. But are they addressing the needs of all entrepreneurs, or just the few? Is this growth sustainable, or merely a flash in the pan?  3. Lemonade Secures â‚¬12M Funding ğŸ’° Once again, the fintech scene shines as Lemonade grabs â‚¬12M in funding. Investors are betting big on brokerage-as-a-service! But will this frenzy distract from the core issues like inclusivity in finance? Are we seeing a bubble forming in fintech that could burst?  4. Exeinâ€™s Cybersecurity Milestone ğŸ” Rome-based Exein has secured â‚¬15M in Series B funding for cybersecurity. Investments are flowing into critical areas like securityâ€”which is encouraging. But are we truly prepared for the rising tide of cyber threats? What protections do startups need to put in place to safeguard their innovations?  5. Tidalkiteâ€™s Sustainable Energy Grant ğŸŒŠ Tidalkite dreams big with a â‚¬2.5 million grant for tidal energy innovation. Government support for sustainable tech is a glimmer of hope. But can we rely solely on grants to power this green transition? Is innovation enough when regulatory frameworks are lagging?  The tech landscape is shifting, yet with these challenges, it also presents golden opportunities. What do you think? Are we ready for the coming changes, or will we see more startups falter? name: Silvia Hsu
position: Talent Consultant at AMD | Connect AI talents hiring for ML Software Engineer | DV | Silicon Design Engineer

name: Frederic Hamon
text: Question is still, alas , if a cheap treatment could interest a lot of people, comparing to the lot of money expected with new expansive treatments ? Perhaps mainly the patients ? â€œFor patients battling the relentless advance of geographic atrophy (GA), a severe form of age-related macular degeneration (AMD), 2023 marked a game-changing moment as the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) greenlit not one, but two revolutionary treatments: pegcetacoplan injection (SYFOVRE) and avacincaptad pegol (IZERVAY).  => However, despite these agents achieving the first FDA approvals, they may not have marked the completion of the GA treatment journey. Although designed to halt the progression of GA, both pegcetacoplan and avacincaptad pegol fall short of preventing the disease or improving a patientâ€™s visual acuity +++ (â€¦) Beyond its primary use as an anti-diabetic medication, metformin has been linked to anti-aging and neuroprotective properties. (â€¦) As AMD is a disease of the retina, and if indeed, metformin has anti-aging properties, it can also affect macular degeneration,â€ Dimitra Skondra , MD, PhD, an associate professor of ophthalmology and visual science at University of Chicago , told HCPLive. â€œThat will be an attractive candidate because itâ€™s a non-invasive way that can be used for a more preventive intervention before people go to the advanced stages and more targeted interventions are needed.â€ (â€¦) In the search for alternative agents to treat GA, metformin is an attractive candidate, not just for its well-tested nature in diabetes, but also for an impressive clinical data set for AMD. Multiple observational studies have reported a protective effect of metformin against the likelihood of AMD development, including dry AMD. (â€¦) => in Skondraâ€™s view, metformin could already slot into the treatment armamentarium as an early-stage treatment, working to delay the progression to GA in a non-invasive matter.Given this promising evidence base, Skondra urged the need for a prospective clinical trial before wider implementation of metformin for GA.  â€œ[Metforminâ€™s] almost the perfect candidate for a non-invasive strategy to target patients when theyâ€™re earlier in the disease stage,â€ Skondra said. â€œItâ€™s safe, affordable, and may help delay the process until they go to advanced stages of wet AMD or GA in particular.â€

name: Mohammed Hassen Mohamed
text: The Latest, Fastest, and Most Intelligent Chips: Development, Power, and Global Leadership:   The rapid evolution of computer chips underpins modern technological advancements, from consumer devices to AI supercomputers.  This article explores the latest breakthroughs in chip technology, focusing on their power, processing capabilities, development history, and the global race for dominance.  The Fastest Chips in the World Recent developments have brought us chips like Intel's Core i9-14900K, AMD's Ryzen 9 7945HX3D, and Apple's M2 Ultra.  These processors deliver exceptional performance, with clock speeds reaching up to 6.0 GHz in the case of Intel's flagship desktop processor.  AMD's Ryzen series offers groundbreaking 3D V-Cache technology, while Appleâ€™s M2 Ultra boasts 24 CPU cores and 76 GPU cores, optimized for multitasking and professional workloads.  AI Supercomputing Chips The Cerebras Wafer Scale Engine 3 (WSE-3) is a revolutionary AI chip featuring 4 trillion transistors and 900,000 AI cores.  Designed for massive AI computations, it powers systems like the Condor Galaxy 3, capable of performing 8 exaFLOPs (1 exaFLOP = 1 quintillion operations per second). This makes it a key player in training next-generation AI models, far surpassing current standards.  Development and Investments Developing cutting-edge chips requires significant investment and innovation. For instance, Cerebras Systems has heavily invested in its Wafer Scale Engine, while companies like Nvidia and AMD continue to refine GPU and CPU technologies.  Governments are also stepping in; the U.S. CHIPS Act allocated billions to semiconductor research and manufacturing, aiming to reduce reliance on overseas production.  Global Leadership in Chip Technology The race for chip supremacy is led by countries like the United States, China, and South Korea.  The U.S. dominates in AI-specific chips with companies like Nvidia, AMD, and Intel, while Taiwan, through TSMC, remains the leader in chip fabrication.  China is rapidly catching up, investing heavily in semiconductor self-sufficiency to counter export restrictions.  Future of Chip Technology The future of chip technology lies in quantum  Conclusion:  Chips are the backbone of modern technology, driving advancements in AI, supercomputing, and consumer devices. As the global race for semiconductor leadership intensifies, investments and innovation will determine the future trajectory of this critical industry.

The anticipated specs, including 8,960 CUDA cores and revolutionary capabilities tailored for both gaming and AI, highlight a significant leap from its predecessor, the RTX 4070 Ti.  This shift underscores NVIDIAâ€™s strategic vision of merging gaming efficiency with powerful AI integration. The use of advanced Tensor Cores and improved fabrication processes indicates a strong focus on innovation and performance.  As competitors like AMD and Intel gear up with their offerings, the race for supremacy in the GPU market is heating up. For gamers, the promise of smoother experiences and enhanced ray tracing technologies is a thrilling prospect.  Stay tuned as we count down to CES 2025â€”this is just the beginning of a new era in graphics! What are your thoughts on this development?

text: Hello everyone, Today we will discuss about Floorplan  ğŸ“ŒFloorplanning is a process of determining the placement of macros and I/O ports.  â—¾ï¸A well and perfect Floorplan leads to an ASIC Design with higher performance and optimum area. On the other hand, a bad floorplan can create issues in the design like congestion, timing, IR drop, routing issues.  â—¾ï¸Before we are going for the floorplanning to make sure that inputs are used for floorplan is prepared properly. â–¶ï¸Inputs for Floorplan: 1. Netlist(.v) 2. Technology file (tech file) 3. Timing Library file(.lib) 4. Physical Library(.lef) 5. Synopsys Design Constraints(.sdc) 6. TLU+ file  â–¶ï¸Objectives of Floorplan 1. Seed for optimal place and route 2. Minimize congestion 3. Meet timing targets 4. Optimize data-flow  â–¶ï¸Tasks of Floorplan 1. Deciding the size of the block 2. Deciding the shape of the block 3. IO port placement 4. Macro placement 5. Physical only cells placement  â–¶ï¸Floorplanning Checklist â€¢ All I/O Ports are placed and in fixed state. They should be on track. â€¢ All Macros are placed in correct orientation and in fixed state. â€¢ No Macros are overlapping. â€¢ IO port routing should not be blocked by macro placement. â€¢ Blockages should be used as needed. â€¢ Use: check_legality. name: YANG
text: Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory introduced El Capitan, now officially the worldâ€™s most powerful supercomputer, claiming the top spot on the TOP500 list. Built with Hewlett Packard Enterprise and AMD, the exscale system can perform over 1 quintillion FLOPS, aiding the National Nuclear Security Administration in modeling nuclear weapons without actually requiring them to explode the bombs. Featuring 11,000 compute nodes and 5.4 petabytes of memory, El Capitan is set to revolutionize nuclear research and advanced simulations.

name: Roger Behr
position: Interim Manager / General & Lean Supply Chain Management
text: Nvidia: the most valuable company in the world! (Nov 21, 2024) The release of Q3 FY25 quarterly figures shows that Nvidia is continuing its formidable growth trend. Nvidia shares have risen up almost 200% in 2024 and up to 1000% in the last 2 years, making Nvidia the most valuable company in the world with a market cap of $3.6 trillion (Apple $3.45 trillion). Nvidia even reached a new all-time high today.  Although the company has struggled to keep up with demand and faced production difficulties this year, no other chipmaker managed to take market share from Nvidia. Its revenue is on track to double for the second year in a row, generating more money in gross profit than it used to generate in revenue, thanks to a 75% gross profit margin.  Nvidia's data center division now generates more revenue than its two closest competitors, Intel and AMD, combined.  Nvidia's flagship product is its AI (accelerator) chip, which facilitates the development of artificial intelligence models by processing massive amounts of data. Since OpenAIâ€™s ChatGPT launch in 2022, a rush for AI services has generated insatiable demand for such chips.  Major Nvidia customers such as Microsoft, Amazonâ€™s AWS and Meta have reiterated their willingness to invest in AI infrastructure, although few have actually made that spending so far.  The company hopes to stay ahead of its rivals by accelerating the pace of innovation. This requires a commitment to update the product line annually. Nvidia is currently introducing Blackwell, a graphics processing unit (GPU) microarchitecture, which is faster and offers improved ability to interface with other chips. This innovation is expected to impact results early next year, although production challenges have delayed its launch. For now, Nvidia canâ€™t keep up with all incoming orders, according to CEO, Jensen Huang. He is confident that once production improves, supplies will be plentiful, assuming that no faster and cheaper chips have been brought to market by competitors in the meantime.  However, investor enthusiasm for artificial intelligence may be outpacing reality. There seems to be a rotation in the stock markets from mega-caps to mid-caps. And by the way, Bitcoin is aiming for $100,000 with a market cap of almost $2 trillion.

name: Allan Kaye
position: Co-Founder and Managing Director at Vespertec | Innovative Open Infrastructure | Servers, Storage, and Networks for Data Centres
text: Christmas seems to come earlier every year - and our partner NVIDIA just gave infrastructure specialists an awesome early gift!  The H200 GPU is now available in PCIe card format - and with a 4 way NVLink bridge kit!  What does this mean?  H200 in regular PCIe card format is extremely useful in itself given the 141GB of HBM memory onboard. In addition, the bridging kit means users can connect up to 4 x H200 PCIe GPU's together over NVLink (and PCIe).  The cards can be deployed in a wide variety of industry-standard//-based server platforms for which suitable systems have been on the market for several years.  Given the 141GB of HBM memory onboard in each GPU, that's 564GB across the four cards.  Performance is slightly down vs the 8 way SXM based H200 equivalent due to the PCIe card being limited to 600W but we see a wide variety of use cases for which this architecture will fit. For example, private LLM, the 4 way architecture will facilitate the use of larger models with higher levels of precision and throughput.  Has this news got you hungry to learn more about NVIDIAâ€™s AI infrastructure? Check out my blog laying out all you need to know!

text: Nvidia Forecast Fails to Meet Wall Street lofty forecast estimates (2 min read)  In the fiscal third quarter ending October 27, 2024, Nvidia reported revenue of $35.1 billion, a staggering 94% year-over-year increase. However, Wall Street's focus shifted to Nvidia's Q4 forecast, which, while exceeding average analyst expectations of $37.1 billion with a projection of $37.5 billion, fell short of the loftiest estimates of $41 billion. This tempered some of the AI-fueled enthusiasm around the company. Despite production delays for its new Blackwell chips and supply constraints, Nvidia's growth remains remarkable, driven by insatiable demand for its AI accelerator chips from industry giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Meta. CEO Jensen Huang underscored the company's commitment to annual innovation and the transformative potential of AI across industries. Although manufacturing hurdles are slowing progress, Nvidia's dominance in AI hardware remains unshaken, even as cautious investors pushed shares down 4%.  My Take  Nvidiaâ€™s tempered outlook for Q4 reflects the natural ebb in hype cycles but underscores the companyâ€™s operational bottlenecks more than market saturation. Its commitment to annual innovation, demonstrated by Blackwell, is an ambitious strategy to maintain dominance, though it risks stretching supply chains thin. As AI adoption spreads across industries and nations, Nvidiaâ€™s challenge will be balancing demand with production scalability to avoid missed opportunities. With competitors like AMD and Intel ramping up their efforts, Nvidiaâ€™s leadership in AI hardware is secure for nowâ€”but only if it can execute flawlessly on its promises. name: Bellier Communication
text: ğŸ”­ This week's Bellier Telescope headlines:   Emerging Markets Brace for Potential Dollar Tsunami; Wall St. Frenzy Creates $11bn Debt Market for Nvidia Chips  ğŸ‘‰ A move by the incoming Trump presidency to impose a potential 60% tariff on Chinese imports could result in a massive 50% offsetting devaluation in the renminbi against the dollar to keep U.S. import prices stable, while sending other Asian and emerging market currencies and commodities prices into freefall in tandem,, senior fellow atwrote in an opinion column in the. â€œChina has historically struggled with capital flight when depreciation expectations take hold in its populace. When this happened in 2015 and 2016, it sparked big outflows that cost China $1trn in official foreign exchange reservesâ€¦The main lesson from that episode is to allow a front-loaded, large fall in the renminbi, so that households cannot front-run depreciation,â€ he said. For emerging markets, such a large depreciation will be seismic. Markets will interpret a tariff war and all the instability that goes with it as a negative for global growth. Secondly, global trade is dollar-denominated, which means emerging markets lose purchasing power when the dollar rises. Financial conditions will â€“ in effect â€“ tighten, which will also weigh on commodities.  ğŸ‘‰ Wall Streetâ€™s largest financial institutions have loaned more than $11 billion to a niche group of â€˜neocloudâ€™ tech companies, including CoreWeave, Crusoe and Lambda Labs, based on their possession of the worldâ€™s hottest commodity -â€™s artificial intelligence chips known as GPUs, raising concerns this could be creating a fast-growing leveraged debt bubble, the FT writes. These companies are pivotal in building AI infrastructure and they have expanded rapidly with CoreWeaveâ€™s valuation soaring to $19bn from $2bn in the past 18 months. Loans are driven by high-demand contracts, such as CoreWeaveâ€™s billion-dollar agreement with Microsoft, and are secured against Nvidiaâ€™s GPUs. â€œThe lenders all coming in push the story that you can borrow against these chips and add to the frenzy that you need to get in now,â€ Nate Koppikar, a short seller at hedge fund Orso Partners, was quoted by the FT as saying. â€But chips are a depreciating, not appreciating, asset.â€ Critics warn that falling GPU prices and increased competition fromand proprietary AI chips threaten Nvidiaâ€™s supply chokehold, while expiring leasing contracts could lead to a market oversupply.

text: ğŸš€ The AI Gold Rush: Wall Street Meets Silicon Valley Wall Street giants like Blackstone, Pimco, and BlackRock have poured over $11 billion into "neocloud" companiesâ€”firms that specialize in providing the computing power behind AI's rapid rise. ğŸ§ ğŸ’» These companies, such as CoreWeave, Crusoe, and Lambda Labs, are snapping up Nvidia's sought-after AI chips (GPUs) and using them as collateral for massive loans. Why the frenzy? Nvidia's GPUs are the backbone of generative AI models like ChatGPT, making them Silicon Valley's hottest commodity. But hereâ€™s the kicker: Nvidia itself is a key investor in these neocloud companies, creating a complex web of financing and supply-chain control. ğŸŒŸ CoreWeave in the Spotlight CoreWeave, now valued at $19 billion, has raised over $10 billion in debt this year alone, leveraging contracts with tech giants like Microsoft to scale its data centers. Yet, with GPUs being a depreciating asset and newer models on the horizon, critics are questioning the sustainability of using these chips as collateral. ğŸ› ï¸ ğŸŒ€ The Bigger Picture While demand for AI infrastructure is immense, the GPU economy is shifting. Prices for GPU compute power are dropping, competition is heating up (AMD is in the race too!), and some tech giants are even building their own chips. Is this a bubble waiting to burst or the start of AIâ€™s next big leap? ğŸ¤” ğŸ’¡ Key takeaway: The AI boom is driving unprecedented investment in infrastructure, but its long-term viability hinges on sustained demand and technological evolution. ğŸ“Œ Original source: Financial Times What do you think? name: Richard Meyer
position: Controls Engineer | Digital Transformation and Industrial IoT Advocate | Exploring the Boundaries of AI for Business & Productivity
text: Built the ultimate AI workstation beast rig on a budget. All lightly used components in a "function over form" open air case.  - AMD EPYC 7763 w/ 64 cores/128 threads w/ 128 PCIE lanes - 160GB DDR4 ECC RAM - 2 x 3090 GPUs for 48GB total VRAM - 6TB NVME storage - powered by a 1600W PSU on a dedicated 20A 115V branch circuit - running ubuntu 22.04, utilizing docker + KVM to take advantage of all the memory & CPU cores for multi-tasking.  I scrounged this system of used parts together all in under 4k. Brand new 3 years ago this system would cost around 15k+. The CPU alone retailed for $8000. Designed primarily for running local AI models, I can easily load 70B models 4-bit quantized with 8k context, 32B models at 6-bit quantized with 32k context (or 8-bit quant with about 16k context). If none of that make sense to you, just know I can run powerful AI models locally with little compromise. And best of all, I can easily expand the system as I'm not limited in any direction, thanks to 128 PCIE lanes & the EPYC architecture. My only limits are how much money I want to throw at extra RAM/GPUs & how much power I want to consume to feed the beast. Though I plan to just add 1 more 3090 and I'll consider this build complete.  The latest qwen coder 32b performs equally or sometimes outperforms with gpt-4o in the latest benchmarks.   This means I can achieve gpt-4o coding performance locally on my own machine, keeping all my data on-prem, with no worries about data privacy or jeopardizing IP.  This was a fun build, and I'm looking forward to continue up-skilling in AI & increasing my productivity using this monster.

It is the first supercomputer dedicated exclusively to support national security efforts by theto accelerate both classified and unclassified studies on scientific discovery and national security, providing the vast computational power necessary to ensure the safety, security and reliability of the nation's nuclear deterrent without testing, as well as materials science, climate modeling, AI model development, power grid modernization, drug discovery and other areas. name: Uwagood Uwagood
text: How Much Faster Is The Ps5 Pro Compared To The Ps5?  The PlayStation 5 Pro is widely anticipated as an enhanced version of Sonyâ€™s current PS5 console, expected to deliver higher performance and faster processing speeds to improve gaming experiences even further. Sonyâ€™s move toward an upgraded PS5 aligns with a broader industry trend of mid-cycle console updates, as seen with the PS4 Pro in the previous generation. With the PS5 already a powerhouse in terms of gaming hardware, many are curious just how much faster the PS5 Pro will be and what these improvements will mean for gameplay, loading times, and graphics performance. RAM and Bandwidth: The PS5 has 16 GB of GDDR6 RAM, which has proven adequate but could be a bottleneck as game assets grow larger and more complex. Additionally, increasing memory bandwidth could allow the console to process data-intensive tasks, such as 4K textures and ray tracing, more efficiently.  Storage (SSD Upgrades): The PS5â€™s ultra-fast SSD, with a read speed of around 5.5 GB/s, was a game-changer upon its release. name: Uwagood Uwagood
text: Will Ps5 Pro Offer Improved Ray Tracing Support?  The PS5 Pro is the much-anticipated upgrade to Sonyâ€™s PlayStation 5, and one of the most exciting features rumored to accompany it is enhanced ray tracing support. Since the launch of the PS5, ray tracing has been a game-changer, making graphics look more realistic by simulating the behavior of light with unprecedented accuracy. Games that support ray tracing can display highly realistic reflections, shadows, and lighting effects, creating a visually immersive experience. But as games become more demanding, thereâ€™s always room for improvement in hardware performance, and the PS5 Pro is anticipated to take ray tracing to the next level.  This article explores whether the PS5 Pro will indeed offer improved ray tracing capabilities, how it might achieve this, and what it could mean for gamers. In doing so, we'll look at the advancements in hardware that are anticipated, the role of ray tracing in modern gaming, and how Sony could leverage new technologies to stay competitive in a market where visual fidelity is becoming a major selling point.  What is Ray Tracing?  Ray tracing is a rendering technique that produces incredibly lifelike lighting effects by tracing the path of light as it interacts with objects in a scene. Traditional rendering methods, like rasterization, approximate light to save processing power, which can sometimes produce less realistic results. In contrast, ray tracing calculates how light interacts with surfaces, including how it reflects, refracts, or absorbs on various materials. This approach has been widely adopted in the film industry for CGI, but its application in real-time video games has only become feasible with the recent generation of gaming consoles and GPUs.  While the PS5 supports ray tracing, it comes at a cost in terms of performance, often requiring games to run at lower frame rates or resolutions to accommodate this demanding feature. With the PS5 Pro, however, gamers are hoping for a smoother experienceâ€”one where they can enjoy high-quality ray tracing without sacrificing frame rate or resolution.  Expected Hardware Improvements in the PS5 Pro  To enable improved ray tracing, the PS5 Pro would need substantial hardware enhancements over the base PS5 model. Here are a few anticipated upgrades:  Enhanced GPU: The PlayStation 5 is equipped with a custom AMD RDNA 2 GPU, which supports ray tracing at a basic level. However, for significant improvement in ray tracing performance, the PS5 Pro will likely need a more powerful GPU, possibly based on AMDâ€™s RDNA 3 or RDNA 4 architecture. These architectures are designed with better ray tracing support, offering more ray tracing cores and improved parallel processing capabilities. An upgraded GPU would allow the PS5 Pro to render more complex ray tracing effects in real time, potentially at higher resolutions and frame rates.  Increased Compute Power: Ray tracing requires intense computational resources, especially for...

text: Major Performance Boost in Linux Kernel from Simple Code Change  Recent advancements in the Linux kernel have resulted in a remarkable performance increase, attributed to a single line of code modification made by Intel. This change has led to a reported 3889% boost in performance for specific workloads, particularly benefiting systems that utilize multiple Intel Xeon processors. The update focuses on optimizing memory management through Transparent Huge Pages (THP), which allows for larger memory allocations, thereby enhancing efficiency for certain processes. While the initial findings suggest a significant improvement, the actual impact varies depending on the specific workload and system architecture, indicating that not all users will experience the same level of enhancement.  However, the update has also revealed some unintended consequences, with reports of performance regressions in various benchmarks and applications. For instance, users have noted up to a 600% drop in performance in certain scenarios, particularly on AMD systems. This has sparked discussions within the community as developers investigate these discrepancies. The incident highlights the dynamic nature of open-source software development, where rapid iterations can lead to both improvements and challenges. Overall, while the kernel update showcases the potential for substantial gains in performance, it also serves as a reminder of the complexities involved in optimizing software across diverse hardware configurations.

text: How Does the PS5 Pro Compare to the Xbox Series X?  The console gaming landscape is heating up as Sony prepares to release the PS5 Pro, an upgraded version of the PS5 designed to push performance, graphics, and features beyond the base model. As the Xbox Series X has been Microsoftâ€™s flagship console since its 2020 release, it already boasts impressive specs and remains a formidable competitor in the gaming world. With the arrival of the PS5 Pro, many gamers are left wondering how it will stack up against the Xbox Series X. Performance and Processing Power  One of the biggest points of comparison between the PS5 Pro and Xbox Series X will be their performance capabilities. While the PS5 and Xbox Series X are quite powerful, the PS5 Pro is expected to raise the bar even further.  CPU and GPU: The Xbox Series X is powered by a custom AMD Zen 2 CPU with 8 cores at 3.8 GHz, paired with an AMD RDNA 2-based GPU, providing 12 teraflops of graphical processing power. Meanwhile, the PS5 Pro is rumored to feature an upgraded AMD Zen 4 CPU and an RDNA 3-based GPU. This could give the PS5 Pro a considerable edge in processing and graphical power, though exact specs arenâ€™t confirmed. If these rumors hold, the PS5 Pro may surpass the Xbox Series X in raw power, potentially offering smoother frame rates and better support for advanced graphical features like ray tracing.  Frame Rates and Resolution: Xbox Series X supports 4K gaming at up to 120 FPS and even offers the potential for 8K output. The PS5 Pro will also target 4K at high frame rates, with the potential for more stable 4K and higher frame rates in more demanding games, thanks to its upgraded hardware. If the PS5 Proâ€™s specs match expectations, it may achieve native 4K at 120 FPS in a wider range of games than the Xbox Series X, providing a slightly more consistent high-performance experience.  Load Times: Both consoles already benefit from fast load times due to their SSDs, but the PS5â€™s custom SSD currently loads games faster than the Xbox Series X in many cases. The PS5 Pro will likely include an even faster SSD, which would further minimize load times. This means that while Xbox Series X is no slouch in terms of load speeds, the PS5 Pro could provide the fastest game loading experience available in the console market.  2. Graphics and Visual Fidelity  Graphics have always been a major selling point for any console, and both the Xbox Series X and the PS5 Pro aim to offer stunning visuals. text: Is the PS5 Pro Worth Upgrading from the PS5?  The PS5 Pro is here, boasting new features and capabilities over the original PS5. With hardware upgrades, enhanced graphics, and faster processing power, many current PS5 owners are wondering whether itâ€™s worth upgrading to the PS5 Pro. Letâ€™s break down the potential advantages, considering graphics, performance, and other key factors that could impact the value of this upgrade.  1. Performance Boost  One of the PS5 Proâ€™s main selling points is its upgraded performance capabilities. Equipped with a more powerful CPU and GPU, the PS5 Pro promises faster load times, more stable frame rates, and improved support for 4K gaming. Hereâ€™s a closer look at the core performance areas that might interest gamers:  Enhanced Processing Power: With a likely jump to a custom AMD RDNA 3-based GPU and a faster Zen 4 CPU, the PS5 Pro is designed for users who want more power for demanding games. If youâ€™re used to the PS5â€™s 30-60 FPS gameplay in certain titles, the PS5 Proâ€™s capability for stable 60-120 FPS gameplay could be compelling. The frame rate boost could mean smoother and more responsive gameplay, especially for fast-paced or graphically intensive titles.  Ray Tracing Improvements: The PS5 Pro's hardware can handle more complex ray tracing, which should lead to better light, shadow, and reflection effects in games that support it. Ray tracing is already impressive on the PS5, but the Pro aims to deliver it at a higher resolution and with fewer performance trade-offs. For players who value graphical fidelity, this could make the upgrade worthwhile.  2. Visual Fidelity and 4K Gaming  For gamers with a 4K TV, the PS5 Proâ€™s enhanced support for 4K resolution could be a significant selling point. The Pro is designed to offer a native 4K experience in more games, reducing the reliance on upscaling. Key visual benefits include:  Higher-Resolution Textures: The PS5 Proâ€™s added power allows developers to use higher-resolution textures in games. This means greater detail in environments, characters, and effects, which can enhance immersion.  More Stable 4K Gaming: While the PS5 can support 4K, it often has to downscale or use dynamic resolution scaling in intensive games to maintain frame rates. The PS5 Pro can better handle native 4K at a consistent 60 FPS or higher, which could lead to a visibly sharper and smoother experience.  8K Potential: Sony has teased potential 8K support for the PS5 Pro, which, while not a mainstream gaming resolution yet, may appeal to future-proofing enthusiasts. However, the practicality of 8K for most gamers is still limited, as 8K monitors and TVs are rare and costly.  3. VR and Expanded Peripheral Support  The PS5 Pro is expected to be optimized for VR gaming, particularly with the PlayStation VR2 headset in mind. With the computer power that is needed recently to open up a game, itâ€™s up to chances whether I can play any games. That is why the recent announcement of AI upscaling on PS5 Pro, called PSSR.  This is not actually new as others have already introduced this kind of upscaling, like FSR by AMD, DLSS by NVIDIA, with both striving to run games at a lower resolution and upscaling them.  While DLSS uses AI and specialized hardware for detailed upscaling, FSR mainly tries to upscale games without any hardware to support so the results may be worse.  PSSR, or PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution, is Sonyâ€™s answer to NVIDIA and AMD. Supposedly it also takes advantage of machine learning hardware to upscale the games and has been trained on various games owned by Sony. So far, the results have been quite good as it may not be able to compete with Nvidiaâ€™s DLSS, it is handily beating FSR. text: I'm astonished by how many tech leaders overlook one of the most impactful strategy in their arsenal:   The power of strategic acquisitions.  In a world where everyone is chasing innovation,  You can stand out by making smart acquisitions.  AMD's recent acquisition of ZT Systems for $4.9 billion is set to rattle the data center market, especially in AI technologies. This move enhances AMD's capabilities in building and deploying data center solutions, which are crucial as businesses adopt AI-driven technologies.  This positions AMD to better compete with NVIDIA, which currently dominates the AI data center market, holding an estimated 88% market share.  By integrating ZT's expertise, AMD aims to create a comprehensive product offering that attracts businesses seeking efficient and scalable data center solutions.  â†’ Expertise of ZT Systems.  â€¢ AI Compute and Storage Infrastructure â€¢ Custom Server Solutions â€¢ Rack-Scale Solutions â€¢ Manufacturing and Deployment  â†’ Value Brought to AMD and its strategic benefits:  â€¢ Accelerated Deployment â€¢ Enhanced Customer Enablement â€¢ Strengthened Competitive Position â€¢ Synergistic Innovation  ZT Systems' 15 years of experience creating scalable data center solutions for major cloud providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud) aligns with AMD's strategy to deliver robust AI training and inference systems. This integration is expected to accelerate the deployment of AMD-powered AI infrastructure, enabling cloud and enterprise customers to implement advanced AI technologies more efficiently.  By combining its high-performance Instinct AI accelerators and EPYC CPUs with ZT's design capabilities, AMD aims to provide end-to-end solutions that can compete directly with NVIDIA's offerings. This strategic move positions AMD to challenge NVIDIA's dominance and attract more customers in the AI data center market.  I look forward to seeing who dominates the GPU market in the coming year and how this strategic acquisition impacts the DC Ecosystem

name: BIT Services Aiken
text: Today is Jean AmÃ©dÃ©e Hoerni's 100th birthday! Oh, you've never heard of him? Good thing it's  hashtag #ThrowbackThursday!  Hoerni was an American engineer who primarily worked with integrated circuits - otherwise known as microchips.  Hoerni (along with 7 other employees) left the Shockley Semiconductor Laboratory to create "Fairchild Semiconductor" in 1957. Note: Shockley called this a "betrayal."  This group of 8 engineers, later termed "the traitorous eight," would go on to be "directly or indirectly involved in the creation of dozens of corporations, including Intel and AMD." (According to one report, these two companies now hold 100% of "the client PC market.")  Chances are, if you're using a computer today, you can thank Jean AmÃ©dÃ©e Hoerni! text: AMD Wants to Compete With Apple's M Max-Series Chips: https://lnkd.in/ePn6J9PZ We heard a few weeks ago that AMD was planning to back off from the GPU market. Its larger strategy might also include taking aim atand its increasingly-better Apple silicon, with a new range of "Max" CPUs. AMD is reportedly gearing up to challenge Apple's dominance in the high-end laptop market with a new line of powerful mobile CPUs, codenamed Strix Halo and now rumored to be called Ryzen AI Max. This new family will sit above AMD's mainstream Ryzen AI 9 chips and target true mobile workstations, offering significantly more graphical power than existing AMD mobile chips.

text: ğŸš€Big news in the AI worldğŸš€ AMD in its bid to be more competitive with Nvidia has announced it's acquiring the AI infrastructure company ZT systems.  The $4.9 Billion acquisition will include cash and stocks. AMD says that ZT systems has experience in designing and optimizing the cloud computing solutions for companies. It will enable AMD to sell its hardware to companies and help them scale their cloud computing and data center operations.  CEO Lisa Su describes it as an "end to end" data center solution at scale. AMD has also acquired another company Silo AI for $665 million last month as a part of its long term strategy to be the industry leader in AI.  The company states that it has invested more than $1 billion into its AI ecosystem and software in the past year.
